item.title: Downtown Casino Center: A Forgotten Brand That Shaped Vintage Las Vegas
item.description:
Remembering Downtown Casino Center: More Than Just a Name

Everyone recognizes the “Welcome to Fabulous Las Vegas” sign. But few know about the equally ambitious, though ultimately faded, branding effort that accompanied it: Downtown Casino Center. Launched in 1959, it wasn’t a casino itself, but a bold attempt to solidify Fremont Street’s identity as the place to be in Las Vegas. It represented a crucial moment in Las Vegas history, a deliberate effort to compete with the burgeoning Strip, which was starting to develop its own distinct appeal.
